doc:
The object is created by a given implementation via its .create_context() virtual method and is used to store cell sizes and alignments for a series of rows that are requested and rendered in the same context.

widgets can create any number of contexts in which to request and render groups of data rows. However, it’s important that the same context which was used to request sizes for a given row also be used for the same row when calling other APIs such as and .

methods.doc:
Allocates a width and/or a height for all rows which are to be rendered with context.

Usually allocation is performed only horizontally or sometimes vertically since a group of rows are usually rendered side by side vertically or horizontally and share either the same width or the same height. Sometimes they are allocated in both horizontal and vertical orientations producing a homogeneous effect of the rows. This is generally the case for when is enabled.

Since 3.0
methods.name: allocate

methods.doc:
Fetches the current allocation size for context.

If the context was not allocated in width or height, or if the context was recently reset with , the returned value will be -1.
methods.name: get_allocation

methods.doc:
Fetches the this context was created by.

This is generally unneeded by layouting widgets; however, it is important for the context implementation itself to fetch information about the area it is being used for.

For instance at .allocate() time it’s important to know details about any cell spacing that the is configured with in order to compute a proper allocation.
methods.name: get_area

methods.doc:
Gets the accumulative preferred height for all rows which have been requested with this context.

After is called and/or before ever requesting the size of a , the returned values are 0.
methods.name: get_preferred_height

methods.doc:
Gets the accumulative preferred height for width for all rows which have been requested for the same said width with this context.

After is called and/or before ever requesting the size of a , the returned values are -1.
methods.name: get_preferred_height_for_width

methods.doc:
Gets the accumulative preferred width for all rows which have been requested with this context.

After is called and/or before ever requesting the size of a , the returned values are 0.
methods.name: get_preferred_width

methods.doc:
Gets the accumulative preferred width for height for all rows which have been requested for the same said height with this context.

After is called and/or before ever requesting the size of a , the returned values are -1.
methods.name: get_preferred_width_for_height

methods.doc:
Causes the minimum and/or natural height to grow if the new proposed sizes exceed the current minimum and natural height.

This is used by implementations during the request process over a series of rows to progressively push the requested height over a series of requests.
methods.name: push_preferred_height

methods.doc:
Causes the minimum and/or natural width to grow if the new proposed sizes exceed the current minimum and natural width.

This is used by implementations during the request process over a series of rows to progressively push the requested width over a series of requests.
methods.name: push_preferred_width

methods.doc:
Resets any previously cached request and allocation data.

When underlying data changes its important to reset the context if the content size is allowed to shrink. If the content size is only allowed to grow (this is usually an option for views rendering large data stores as a measure of optimization), then only the row that changed or was inserted needs to be (re)requested with .

When the new overall size of the context requires that the allocated size changes (or whenever this allocation changes at all), the variable row sizes need to be re-requested for every row.

For instance, if the rows are displayed all with the same width from top to bottom then a change in the allocated width necessitates a recalculation of all the displayed row heights using .

Since 3.0
methods.name: reset

name: CellAreaContext

properties.doc: The this context was created by
properties.name: area

properties.doc: The minimum height for the in this context for all rows that this context was requested for using .
properties.name: minimum-height

properties.doc: The minimum width for the in this context for all rows that this context was requested for using .
properties.name: minimum-width

properties.doc: The natural height for the in this context for all rows that this context was requested for using .
properties.name: natural-height

properties.doc: The natural width for the in this context for all rows that this context was requested for using .
properties.name: natural-width
